An **orc mummy**, M, is a type of [monster](/wiki/Monster "Monster") that appears in *[NetHack](/wiki/NetHack "NetHack")*. It is a mummified [orc](/wiki/Orc_\(monster_attribute\) "Orc (monster attribute)") that will seek out and collect [gold](/wiki/Gold "Gold") and [gems](/wiki/Gem "Gem").

An orc mummy has a single claw attack.

*The following information pertains to an upcoming version ([3.7.0](/wiki/3.7.0 "3.7.0")). If this version is now released, please verify that it is still accurate, then update the page to incorporate this information.*

As of [commit b6a3d4b](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/commit/b6a3d4b984eb118ddb02f1605d76b1010df76055), the orc mummy is given the [M2\_STRONG](/wiki/M2_STRONG "M2 STRONG") flag.

[ ]

## Contents

- [1 Generation](#Generation)

- [2 History](#History)

- [3 Variants](#Variants)

  - [3.1 SLASH'EM](#SLASH.27EM)
  - [3.2 dNetHack](#dNetHack)
  - [3.3 SpliceHack](#SpliceHack)
  - [3.4 EvilHack](#EvilHack)
  - [3.5 Hack'EM](#Hack.27EM)

- [4 Encyclopedia entry](#Encyclopedia_entry)

- [5 References](#References)

## Generation

Randomly-generated orc mummies are always hostile.

Orc mummies have a 6⁄7 chance of [being generated with](/wiki/Monster_starting_inventory "Monster starting inventory") a [mummy wrapping](/wiki/Mummy_wrapping "Mummy wrapping").[\[1\]](#cite_note-1)

Orc mummies may appear among the mummies that are part of the second quest monster class for [Archeologists](/wiki/Archeologist "Archeologist") and make up 6⁄175 of the monsters that are randomly generated on the [Archeologist quest](/wiki/Archeologist_quest "Archeologist quest").

An orc mummy leaves behind an aged [orc](/wiki/Orc_\(monster\) "Orc (monster)") [corpse](/wiki/Corpse "Corpse") upon death.[\[2\]](#cite_note-undead_to_corpse-2)[\[3\]](#cite_note-make_corpse-3)

## History

The orc mummy first appears in [NetHack 3.0.0](/wiki/NetHack_3.0.0 "NetHack 3.0.0"), where most of the various mummies are introduced.

## Variants

### SLASH'EM

In [SLASH'EM](/wiki/SLASH%27EM "SLASH'EM"), two orc mummies are generated in the room of [Grund's Stronghold](/wiki/Grund%27s_Stronghold "Grund's Stronghold") containing the [throne](/wiki/Throne "Throne") at level creation.

Orc mummies may appear among the mummies that are part of the first quest monster class for [Undead Slayers](/wiki/Undead_Slayer "Undead Slayer") and make up 24⁄175 of the monsters that are randomly generated on the [Undead Slayer quest](/wiki/Undead_Slayer_quest "Undead Slayer quest").

### dNetHack

In [dNetHack](/wiki/DNetHack "DNetHack"), orc mummies are stronger and can inflict [mummy curses](/wiki/Mummy_curse "Mummy curse") on whoever kills them.

### SpliceHack

In [SpliceHack](/wiki/SpliceHack "SpliceHack"), orc mummies can inflict [withering](/wiki/Withering "Withering") with their melee attacks.

### EvilHack

In [EvilHack](/wiki/EvilHack "EvilHack"), orc mummies can inflict withering with their melee attacks.

### Hack'EM

In addition to SLASH'EM details, orc mummies in [Hack'EM](/wiki/Hack%27EM "Hack'EM") can also inflict withering with their melee attacks as in EvilHack.

## Encyclopedia entry

But for an account of the manner in which the body was  
bandaged, and a list of the unguents and other materials  
employed in the process, and the words of power which were  
spoken as each bandage was laid in its place, we must have  
recourse to a very interesting papyrus which has been edited  
and translated by M. Maspero under the title of Le Rituel de  
l'Embaumement. ...  
Everything that could be done to preserve the body was now  
done, and every member of it was, by means of the words of  
power which changed perishable substances into imperishable,  
protected to all eternity; when the final covering of purple  
or white linen had been fastened upon it, the body was ready  
for the tomb.

\[ Egyptian Magic, by E.A. Wallis Budge ]

## References

1. [↑](#cite_ref-1) [src/makemon.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 740](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.7_Released/src/makemon.c#L740)
2. [↑](#cite_ref-undead_to_corpse_2-0) [src/mon.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 147](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.7_Released/src/mon.c#L147): *Converting monster index of undead to corpses of their living counterparts*
3. [↑](#cite_ref-make_corpse_3-0) [src/mon.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 372](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.7_Released/src/mon.c#L372): *Undead corpses and their ages are handled with other "special" death drops*

Orc mummy

From NetHackWiki
Jump to navigation Jump to search
M orc mummy
Difficulty 6
Attacks Claw 1d6
M orc mummy
Difficulty 6
Attacks

Claw 1d6

Base level 5
Base experience 56
Speed 10
Base AC 5
Base MR 20
Alignment −4 (chaotic)
Frequency (by normal means) 1 (Very rare)
Genocidable Yes
Weight 850
Nutritional value 75
Size Medium
Resistances Cold, Sleep, Poison
Resistances conveyed None

An orc mummy:

  • does not breathe.
  • is mindless.
  • has a head, a couple of arms, and a torso.
  • is poisonous to eat.
  • does not eat. (*)
  • is undead.
  • is an orc.
  • is normally generated hostile.
  • likes gold.
  • likes gems.
  • has infravision.
  • can leave an old orc corpse.
Reference monst.c#line1679

An orc mummy, M, is a type of monster that appears in NetHack. It is a mummified orc that will seek out and collect gold and gems.

An orc mummy has a single claw attack.

The following information pertains to an upcoming version (3.7.0). If this version is now released, please verify that it is still accurate, then update the page to incorporate this information.

As of commit b6a3d4b, the orc mummy is given the M2_STRONG flag.

Contents

  • 1 Generation
  • 2 History
  • 3 Variants
    • 3.1 SLASH'EM
    • 3.2 dNetHack
    • 3.3 SpliceHack
    • 3.4 EvilHack
    • 3.5 Hack'EM
  • 4 Encyclopedia entry
  • 5 References

Generation

Randomly-generated orc mummies are always hostile.

Orc mummies have a 6⁄7 chance of being generated with a mummy wrapping.[1]

Orc mummies may appear among the mummies that are part of the second quest monster class for Archeologists and make up 6⁄175 of the monsters that are randomly generated on the Archeologist quest.

An orc mummy leaves behind an aged orc corpse upon death.[2][3]

History

The orc mummy first appears in NetHack 3.0.0, where most of the various mummies are introduced.

Variants

SLASH'EM

In SLASH'EM, two orc mummies are generated in the room of Grund's Stronghold containing the throne at level creation.

Orc mummies may appear among the mummies that are part of the first quest monster class for Undead Slayers and make up 24⁄175 of the monsters that are randomly generated on the Undead Slayer quest.

dNetHack

In dNetHack, orc mummies are stronger and can inflict mummy curses on whoever kills them.

SpliceHack

In SpliceHack, orc mummies can inflict withering with their melee attacks.

EvilHack

In EvilHack, orc mummies can inflict withering with their melee attacks.

Hack'EM

In addition to SLASH'EM details, orc mummies in Hack'EM can also inflict withering with their melee attacks as in EvilHack.

Encyclopedia entry

But for an account of the manner in which the body was
bandaged, and a list of the unguents and other materials
employed in the process, and the words of power which were
spoken as each bandage was laid in its place, we must have
recourse to a very interesting papyrus which has been edited
and translated by M. Maspero under the title of Le Rituel de
l'Embaumement. ...
Everything that could be done to preserve the body was now
done, and every member of it was, by means of the words of
power which changed perishable substances into imperishable,
protected to all eternity; when the final covering of purple
or white linen had been fastened upon it, the body was ready
for the tomb.

[ Egyptian Magic, by E.A. Wallis Budge ]

References

  1. ↑ src/makemon.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 740
  2. ↑ src/mon.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 147: Converting monster index of undead to corpses of their living counterparts
  3. ↑ src/mon.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 372: Undead corpses and their ages are handled with other "special" death drops

An '''orc mummy''', {{monsym|orc mummy}}, is a type of [[monster]] that appears in ''[[NetHack]]''. It is a mummified [[Orc (monster attribute)|orc]] that will seek out and collect [[gold]] and [[gem]]s.

An orc mummy has a single claw attack.

{{upcoming|3.7.0|As of {{commit|b6a3d4b984eb118ddb02f1605d76b1010df76055|commit b6a3d4b}}, the orc mummy is given the [[M2_STRONG]] flag.}}

==Generation==
Randomly-generated orc mummies are always hostile.

Orc mummies have a {{frac|6|7}} chance of [[Monster starting inventory|being generated with]] a [[mummy wrapping]].{{refsrc|src/makemon.c|740|nethack=3.6.7}}

Orc mummies may appear among the mummies that are part of the second quest monster class for [[Archeologist]]s and make up {{frac|6|175}} of the monsters that are randomly generated on the [[Archeologist quest]].

An orc mummy leaves behind an aged [[Orc (monster)|orc]] [[corpse]] upon death.{{refsrc|src/mon.c|147|nethack=3.6.7|name="undead_to_corpse"|comment=Converting monster index of undead to corpses of their living counterparts}}{{refsrc|src/mon.c|372|nethack=3.6.7|name="make_corpse"|comment=Undead corpses and their ages are handled with other "special" death drops}}

==History==
The orc mummy first appears in [[NetHack 3.0.0]], where most of the various mummies are introduced.

==Variants==
===SLASH'EM===
In [[SLASH'EM]], two orc mummies are generated in the room of [[Grund's Stronghold]] containing the [[throne]] at level creation.

Orc mummies may appear among the mummies that are part of the first quest monster class for [[Undead Slayer]]s and make up {{frac|24|175}} of the monsters that are randomly generated on the [[Undead Slayer quest]].

===dNetHack===
In [[dNetHack]], orc mummies are stronger and can inflict [[mummy curse]]s on whoever kills them.

===SpliceHack===
In [[SpliceHack]], orc mummies can inflict [[withering]] with their melee attacks.

===EvilHack===
In [[EvilHack]], orc mummies can inflict withering with their melee attacks.

===Hack'EM===
In addition to SLASH'EM details, orc mummies in [[Hack'EM]] can also inflict withering with their melee attacks as in EvilHack.

==Encyclopedia entry==
{{encyclopedia|
But for an account of the manner in which the body was
bandaged, and a list of the unguents and other materials
employed in the process, and the words of power which were
spoken as each bandage was laid in its place, we must have
recourse to a very interesting papyrus which has been edited
and translated by M. Maspero under the title of Le Rituel de
l'Embaumement. ...
Everything that could be done to preserve the body was now
done, and every member of it was, by means of the words of
power which changed perishable substances into imperishable,
protected to all eternity; when the final covering of purple
or white linen had been fastened upon it, the body was ready
for the tomb.
|[ Egyptian Magic, by E.A. Wallis Budge ]
}}
